title: searching body of deleted emails
content: I can't select "body" to find messages that are in the deleted folder of thunderbird. I can select "body" for the inbox. Does anyone else see this? Is it a bug?
creator: bjlockie

title: Indexing nightmare, constantly trying to index hundreds of thousands of messages
content:
I've been using TB since the beginning, so like 20 years now, congrats! (to me ðŸ˜œ) Now IÂ have at least 10 accounts and hundreds of folders and everything was fine until I started archiving some old messages in one account, and TBÂ began creating new archive folders like YYYY/YYYY-MM which were being included in the Global Search/indexer by default. So I went to the properties of each folder and unchecked the option to include it in the Global Search results. I could see in the Activity Monitor the indexing of that folder would stop and go on to the next one, until I disabled all 12. Now TB is indexing over 100,000 messages but it doesn't say what folder these are in, I can't seem to find it.

What I did find is the global-messages-db.sqlite database which, after closing TB, I made a backup of, then I found the folderLocations table with hundreds of rows and the IndexingPriority column which had various values of: -1, 20, 40, 50, and 60. I set them all to -1 and TB is still trying to index over 100,000 messages somewhere. Where? and how to stop its madness?!
creator: scarlion

title: Lost email account
content: I was having trouble with the my supplier email address, and they asked me to reset it. It then seemed to have disappeared so I set up a new account. Suddenly I ended up with 2 accounts with the same emails. After agonising over whether or not I should remove it, IU removed what I thought was the duplicate account. I find I Have removed the first account, and the second one is there but has no emails. I keep everything! Now I have nothing. Is there a way to recover it?
creator: margaretcmurray

title: downloading emails in Thunderbird
content: Suddenly yesterday afternoon I became unable to download emails to Thunderbird (I can still do it in talktalk). I get a message "Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges and you have enough disc space to copy the mailbox." I have checked there is plenty of disc space. What can I do to get the system working again? I suspect Thunderbird downloaded an update yesterday.
creator: amral

title: downloading emails in Thunderbird
content: In answer to question from Chris, my AV software is AVG free version.
creator: amral
